content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-049-05-B
|Item_parent=Normal and pathological puberty
|Item_parent_short=Normal and pathological puberty
|Rank=B
|Title=To know the average age of onset of peak bone growth
|Description=None
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=5}}
The acceleration in the rate of statural growth begins with the first signs of puberty in girls (S2), and is delayed in boys (G3). The average pubertal growth peak is 20-25 cm in girls and 25-30 cm in boys.

properties.question: At what average age range does peak bone growth occur during puberty?
properties.option_a: 10-12 years for girls and 12-14 years for boys
properties.option_b: 12-14 years for girls and 14-16 years for boys
properties.option_c: 20-25 years for girls and 25-30 years for boys
properties.option_d: 14-16 years for girls and 16-18 years for boys
